alert.note: Alert for Coos (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 01 at 5:43PM EDT until May 02 at 2:32PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM EDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of Maine, including the following counties, Franklin, Oxford and Somerset. Portions of northern New Hampshire, including the following county, Coos. * WHEN...Until 500 AM EDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 541 PM EDT, Minor flooding is ongoing in the advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Even though the rain has moved out, there will be continued flooding caused by high flowing streams. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Eustis, Rangeley, Rumford, Kingfield, Bingham, Andover, Carrabassett Valley, Errol, Phillips and Weld.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
